maml:description.maml:para: Adds a cluster identity to a cluster configuration object.
The Add-AzureRmHDInsightClusterIdentity cmdlet adds a cluster identity to the Azure HDInsight configuration object created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the HDInsight cluster configuration object that this cmdlet modifies. This object is created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the Azure AD object ID (a GUID) of the Azure AD Service Principal that represents the cluster. The cluster will use this when accessing Azure Data Lake Store.
Specifies the file path to the certificate that will be used to authenticate as the Service Principal. The cluster will use this when accessing Azure Data Lake Store.
Specifies the password for the certificate that will be used to authenticate as the Service Principal. The cluster will use this when accessing Azure Data Lake Store.
Specifies the Azure AD Tenant ID that will be used when accessing Azure Data Lake Store.
Specifies the HDInsight cluster configuration object that this cmdlet modifies. This object is created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.

Specifies file contents of the certificate that will be used when accessing Azure Data Lake Store.
Specifies the password for the certificate that will be used to authenticate as the Service Principal. The cluster will use this when accessing Azure Data Lake Store.
Specifies the Azure AD Tenant ID that will be used when accessing Azure Data Lake Store.
Specifies the HDInsight cluster configuration object that this cmdlet modifies. This object is created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.

Specifies the password for the certificate that will be used to authenticate as the Service Principal. The cluster will use this when accessing Azure Data Lake Store.
Specifies the Azure AD Tenant ID that will be used when accessing Azure Data Lake Store.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Add Cluster Identity info to the cluster configuration object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> # Primary storage account info $storageAccountResourceGroupName = "Group" $storageAccountName = "yourstorageacct001" $storageAccountKey = Get-AzureStorageAccountKey ` -ResourceGroupName $storageAccountResourceGroupName ` -Name $storageAccountName | %{ $_.Key1 } $storageContainer = "container001"
# Cluster configuration info $location = "East US 2" $clusterResourceGroupName = "Group" $clusterName = "your-hadoop-001" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential
# If the cluster's resource group doesn't exist yet, run: # New-AzureRmResourceGroup -Name $clusterResourceGroupName -Location $location
# Cluster Identity values $tenantId = (Get-AzureRmContext).Tenant.TenantId $objectId = "<Azure AD Service Principal Object ID>" $certificateFilePath = "<Path to Azure AD Service Principal Certificate>" $certificatePassword = "<Password for Azure AD Service Principal Certificate>" $CertificateFileContents = "<File contents of Azure AD Service Principal Certificate>"
# Create the cluster, pass either $certificateFilePath or $CertificateFileContents New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig ` | Add-AzureRmHDInsightClusterIdentity ` -AadTenantId $tenantId ` -ObjectId $objectId ` -CertificateFilePath $certificateFilePath ` -CertificatePassword $certificatePassword ` | New-AzureRmHDInsightCluster ` -ClusterType Hadoop ` -OSType Windows ` -ClusterSizeInNodes 4 ` -ResourceGroupName $clusterResourceGroupName ` -ClusterName $clusterName ` -HttpCredential $clusterCreds ` -Location $location ` -DefaultStorageAccountName "$storageAccountName.blob.core.windows.net" ` -DefaultStorageAccountKey $storageAccountKey ` -DefaultStorageContainer $storageAccountContainer

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds Cluster Identity info to the cluster named 'your-hadoop-001', allowing the cluster to access Azure Data Lake Store.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Add a custom configuration value to the cluster configuration object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> # Primary storage account info $storageAccountResourceGroupName = "Group" $storageAccountName = "yourstorageacct001" $storageAccountKey = Get-AzureStorageAccountKey ` -ResourceGroupName $storageAccountResourceGroupName ` -Name $storageAccountName | %{ $_.Key1 } $storageContainer = "container001"
# Cluster configuration info $location = "East US 2" $clusterResourceGroupName = "Group" $clusterName = "your-hadoop-001" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential
# If the cluster's resource group doesn't exist yet, run: # New-AzureRmResourceGroup -Name $clusterResourceGroupName -Location $location
# Config values $coreConfigs = @{"io.file.buffer.size"="300000"} $mapRedConfigs = @{"mapred.map.max.attempts"="2"}
# Create the cluster New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig ` | Add-AzureRmHDInsightConfigValues ` -Core $coreConfigs ` -MapRed $mapRedConfigs ` | New-AzureRmHDInsightCluster ` -ClusterType Hadoop ` -OSType Windows ` -ClusterSizeInNodes 4 ` -ResourceGroupName $clusterResourceGroupName ` -ClusterName $clusterName ` -HttpCredential $clusterCreds ` -Location $location ` -DefaultStorageAccountName "$storageAccountName.blob.core.windows.net" ` -DefaultStorageAccountKey $storageAccountKey ` -DefaultStorageContainer $storageAccountContainer

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a Hadoop configuration value to the cluster named 'your-hadoop-001'.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a SQL Database to serve as a Hive or Oozie metastore to a cluster configuration object.

The Add-AzureRmHDInsightMetastore cmdlet adds a Hive or Oozie metastore to the HDInsight configuration object created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet. A metastore is a SQL Database that can used to store metadata for Hive, Oozie, or both.
Specifies the HDInsight cluster configuration object that this cmdlet modifies. This object is created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the type of metastore. Possible values are HiveMetastore or OozieMetastore.
Specifies the Azure SQL Server instance to use for this metastore.
Specifies the database on the Azure SQL Server instance to use for this metastore.
Specifies the credentials to use for the Azure SQL Server database.
Specifies the HDInsight cluster configuration object that this cmdlet modifies. This object is created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the type of metastore. Possible values are HiveMetastore or OozieMetastore.
Specifies the Azure SQL Server instance to use for this metastore.
Specifies the database on the Azure SQL Server instance to use for this metastore.
Specifies the credentials to use for the Azure SQL Server database.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Add a SQL database metastore to the cluster configuration object. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> # Primary storage account info $storageAccountResourceGroupName = "Group" $storageAccountName = "yourstorageacct001" $storageAccountKey = Get-AzureStorageAccountKey ` -ResourceGroupName $storageAccountResourceGroupName ` -Name $storageAccountName | %{ $_.Key1 } $storageContainer = "container001"
# Cluster configuration info $location = "East US 2" $clusterResourceGroupName = "Group" $clusterName = "your-hadoop-001" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential
# If the cluster's resource group doesn't exist yet, run: # New-AzureRMResourceGroup -Name $clusterResourceGroupName -Location $location
# Hive metastore info $hiveSqlServer = "your-sqlserver-001" $hiveDb = "your-sqldb-001" $hiveCreds = Get-Credential
# Oozie metastore info $oozieSqlServer = "your-sqlserver-001" $oozieDb = "your-sqldb-002" $oozieCreds = Get-Credential
# Create the cluster New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig ` | Add-AzureRmHDInsightMetastore ` -SqlAzureServerName "$oozieSqlServer.database.contoso.net" ` -DatabaseName $oozieDb ` -Credential $oozieCreds ` -MetastoreType OozieMetastore ` | Add-AzureRmHDInsightMetastore ` -SqlAzureServerName "$hiveSqlServer.database.contoso.net" ` -DatabaseName $hiveDb ` -Credential $hiveCreds ` -MetastoreType HiveMetastore ` | New-AzureRmHDInsightCluster ` -ClusterType Hadoop ` -OSType Windows ` -ClusterSizeInNodes 4 ` -ResourceGroupName $clusterResourceGroupName ` -ClusterName $clusterName ` -HttpCredential $clusterCreds ` -Location $location ` -DefaultStorageAccountName "$storageAccountName.blob.core.contoso.net" ` -DefaultStorageAccountKey $storageAccountKey ` -DefaultStorageContainer $storageContainer

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a SQL database metastore to the cluster named 'your-hadoop-001'.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a script action to a cluster configuration object.
The Add-AzureRmHDInsightScriptAction cmdlet adds script actions to the HDInsight configuration object created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.

Script actions provide functionality that is used to install additional software or to change the configuration of applications that run on a Hadoop cluster by using Windows PowerShell or Bash scripts (for Windows or Linux clusters, respectively).

A script action runs on the cluster nodes when HDInsight clusters are deployed, and they run after nodes in the cluster complete HDInsight configuration. The script action runs under system administrator account privileges and provides full access rights to the cluster nodes. You can provide each cluster with a list of script actions to run in a specified sequence.
Specifies the HDInsight cluster configuration object that this cmdlet modifies. This object is created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the node type on which to run the script action.
Specifies the public URI for the script action (a PowerShell or Bash script).
Specifies the name of the script action.
Specifies the parameters for the script action.
Specifies the HDInsight cluster configuration object that this cmdlet modifies. This object is created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the node type on which to run the script action.
Specifies the public URI for the script action (a PowerShell or Bash script).
Specifies the name of the script action.
Specifies the parameters for the script action.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Add a script action to the cluster configuration object. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> # Primary storage account info $storageAccountResourceGroupName = "Group" $storageAccountName = "yourstorageacct001" $storageAccountKey = Get-AzureStorageAccountKey ` -ResourceGroupName $storageAccountResourceGroupName ` -Name $storageAccountName | %{ $_.Key1 } $storageContainer = "container001"
# Script action info $scriptActionName = "<script action name>" $scriptActionURI = "<script action URI>" $scriptActionParameters = "<script action parameters>"
# Cluster configuration info $location = "East US 2" $clusterResourceGroupName = "Group" $clusterName = "your-hadoop-001" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential
# If the cluster's resource group doesn't exist yet, run: # New-AzureRmResourceGroup -Name $clusterResourceGroupName -Location $location
# Create the cluster New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig ` | Add-AzureRmHDInsightScriptAction ` -Name $scriptActionName ` -Uri $scriptActionURI ` -Parameters $scriptActionParameters ` -NodeType Worker ` | Add-AzureRmHDInsightScriptAction ` -Name $scriptActionName ` -Uri $scriptActionURI ` -Parameters $scriptActionParameters ` -NodeType Head ` | New-AzureRmHDInsightCluster ` -ClusterType Hadoop ` -OSType Windows ` -ClusterSizeInNodes 4 ` -ResourceGroupName $clusterResourceGroupName ` -ClusterName $clusterName ` -HttpCredential $clusterCreds ` -Location $location ` -DefaultStorageAccountName "$storageAccountName.blob.core.contoso.net" ` -DefaultStorageAccountKey $storageAccountKey ` -DefaultStorageContainer $storageContainer

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a script action for the Head and Worker nodes of the 'your-hadoop-001' cluster, to be run at the end of cluster creation.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Get recent jobs for a specified Azure HDInsight cluster --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:

maml:description.maml:para: Submits a Hive query to an HDInsight cluster and retrieves query results in one operation.

The Invoke-AzureRmHDInsightHiveJob cmdlet submits a Hive query to an Azure HDInsight cluster and retrieves query results in one operation. Use the Use-AzureRmHDInsightCluster cmdlet before calling Invoke-AzureRmHDInsightHiveJob to specify which cluster will be used for the query.
Specifies an array of arguments for the job. The arguments are passed as command-line arguments to each task.
Specifies a collection of files that are required for a Hive job.
Specifies the location of the folder that contains standard outputs and error outputs for a job.
Specifies Hadoop configuration values to set when a job runs.
Specifies the path to a file in Azure Storage that contains the query to run. You can use this parameter instead of the Query parameter.
Specifies the name of a Hive job. If you do not specify this parameter, this cmdlet uses the default value: "Hive: <first 100 characters of Query>".
Specifies the Hive query.
Indicates that this cmdlet creates a file in the default Azure storage account in which to store a query. This cmdlet submits the job that references this file as a script to run.

You can use this functionality to handle special characters such as percent sign (%) that would fail on a job submission through Templeton, because Templeton interprets a query with a percent sign as a URL parameter.
Specifies the name of the default container in the default Azure storage account that an HDInsight cluster uses.
Specifies the name of the default storage account that the HDInsight cluster uses.
Specifies the account key for the default storage account that the HDInsight cluster uses.
Specifies an array of arguments for the job. The arguments are passed as command-line arguments to each task.
Specifies a collection of files that are required for a Hive job.
Specifies the location of the folder that contains standard outputs and error outputs for a job.

Specifies the path to a file in Azure Storage that contains the query to run. You can use this parameter instead of the Query parameter.
Specifies the name of a Hive job. If you do not specify this parameter, this cmdlet uses the default value: "Hive: <first 100 characters of Query>".
Specifies the Hive query.
Indicates that this cmdlet creates a file in the default Azure storage account in which to store a query. This cmdlet submits the job that references this file as a script to run.

You can use this functionality to handle special characters such as percent sign (%) that would fail on a job submission through Templeton, because Templeton interprets a query with a percent sign as a URL parameter.
Specifies the name of the default container in the default Azure storage account that an HDInsight cluster uses.
Specifies the name of the default storage account that the HDInsight cluster uses.
Specifies the account key for the default storage account that the HDInsight cluster uses.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Submit a Hive query to an Azure HDInsight cluster --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> # Primary storage account info $storageAccountResourceGroupName = "Group" $storageAccountName = "yourstorageacct001" $storageAccountKey = Get-AzureStorageAccountKey ` -ResourceGroupName $storageAccountResourceGroupName ` -Name $storageAccountName | %{ $_.Key1 } $storageContainer = "container001"
# Cluster info $clusterName = "your-hadoop-001" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential
# Hive job details $statusFolder = "tempStatusFolder/" $query = "SHOW TABLES"
Use-AzureRmHDInsightCluster -ClusterCredential $clusterCreds ` -ClusterName $clusterName
Invoke-AzureRmHDInsightHiveJob -StatusFolder $statusFolder ` -Query $query ` -DefaultContainer $storageAccountContainer ` -DefaultStorageAccountName "$storageAccountName.blob.core.windows.net" ` -DefaultStorageAccountKey $storageAccountKey

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command submits the query SHOW TABLES to the cluster named 'your-hadoop-001'.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an Azure HDInsight cluster in the specified resource group for the current subscription.

The New-AzureHDInsightCluster creates an Azure HDInsight cluster by using the specified parameters or by using a configuration object that is created by using the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the location for the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the number of Worker nodes for the cluster.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.
Specifies the name of the default Azure Storage account that the HDInsight cluster will use. You can alternatively use the Set-AzureRmHDInsightDefaultStorage cmdlet.
Specifies the account key for the default Azure Storage account that the HDInsight cluster will use. You can alternatively use the Set-AzureRmHDInsightDefaultStorage cmdlet.
Specifies the cluster object to be used to create the cluster. This object can be created by using the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the SQL Database to store Oozie metadata. You can alternatively use the Add-AzureRmHDInsightMetastore cmdlet.
Specifies the SQL Database to store Hive metadata. You can alternatively use the Add-AzureRmHDInsightMetastore cmdlet.
Specifies the additional Azure Storage accounts for the cluster. You can alternatively use the Add-AzureRmHDInsightStorage cmdlet.
Specifies the configurations of this HDInsight cluster. You can alternatively use the Add-AzureRmHDInsightConfigValues cmdlet.
Specifies the script actions to run on the cluster at the end of cluster creation. You can alternatively use Add-AzureRmHDInsightScriptAction.
Specifies the name of the default container in the default Azure storage account that the HDInsight cluster will use. You can alternatively use the Set-AzureRmHDInsightDefaultStorage cmdlet.
Specifies the HDI version of the HDInsight cluster.
Specifies the size of the virtual machine for the Head node. Use Get-AzureRmVMSize for acceptable VM sizes, and see HDInsight's pricing page.
Specifies the size of the virtual machine for the Worker node. Use Get-AzureRmVMSize for acceptable VM sizes, and see HDInsight's pricing page.

Specifies the size of the virtual machine for the Zookeeper node. Use Get-AzureRmVMSize for acceptable VM sizes, and see HDInsight's pricing page. This parameter is valid only for HBase or Storm clusters.
Specifies the type of cluster to create. Options are: Hadoop, HBase, Storm, Spark
Specifies the ID of the virtual network into which to provision the cluster.
Specifies the name of a subnet within the chosen virtual network for the cluster.
Specifies the operating system for the cluster. Options are: Windows, Linux
Specifies the HDInsight cluster tier. By default, this is Standard. The Premium tier can only be used with Linux clusters, and it enables the use of some new features.
Specifies the SSH credential to be used for SSH connections. This is only for Linux clusters.
Specifies the public key to be used for SSH connections. This is only for Linux clusters.
Specifies the Remote Desktop (RDP) credentials for the cluster. This is only for Windows clusters.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create an Azure HDInsight cluster --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> # Primary storage account info $storageAccountResourceGroupName = "Group" $storageAccountName = "yourstorageacct001" $storageAccountKey = Get-AzureStorageAccountKey ` -ResourceGroupName $storageAccountResourceGroupName ` -Name $storageAccountName | %{ $_.Key1 } $storageContainer = "container002"
# Cluster configuration info $location = "East US 2" $clusterResourceGroupName = "Group" $clusterName = "your-hadoop-002" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential
# If the cluster's resource group doesn't exist yet, run: # New-AzureRMResourceGroup -Name $clusterResourceGroupName -Location $location
# Create the cluster New-AzureRmHDInsightCluster ` -ClusterType Hadoop ` -OSType Windows ` -ClusterSizeInNodes 4 ` -ResourceGroupName $clusterResourceGroupName ` -ClusterName $clusterName ` -HttpCredential $clusterCreds ` -Location $location ` -DefaultStorageAccountName "$storageAccountName.blob.core.contoso.net" ` -DefaultStorageAccountKey $storageAccountKey ` -DefaultStorageContainer $storageContainer

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a Hive job object.
The New-AzureRmHDInsightHiveJobDefinition cmdlet defines a Hive job object for use with an Azure HDInsight cluster.
Specifies an array of arguments for the job. The arguments are passed as command-line arguments to each task.
Specifies a collection of files that are associated with a Hive job.
Specifies the location of the folder that contains standard outputs and error outputs for a job.
Specifies Hadoop configuration values to set for when the job runs.
Specifies the path to a file that contains a query to run. You can use this parameter instead of the Query parameter.
Specifies the name of the job.
Specifies the Hive query.
Indicates that this cmdlet creates a file in the default Azure storage account in which to store a query. This cmdlet submits the job that references this file as a script to run.

You can use this functionality to handle special characters such as percent sign (%) that would fail on a job submission through Templeton, because Templeton interprets a query with a percent sign as a URL parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified HDInsight cluster from the current subscription.

The Remove-AzureRmHDInsightCluster cmdlet removes the specified HDInsight service cluster from a subscription. This operation also deletes any data stored in the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) on the cluster. Data stored in the associated Azure Storage account is not deleted. Data stored in external metastores is not deleted.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Remove-AzureRmHDInsightCluster -ClusterName "your-hadoop-001"

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an persisted script action from an HDInsight cluster.

The Remove-AzureRmHDInsightPersistedScriptAction cmdlet removes a persisted script action from the specified Azure HDInsight cluster's list of persisted script actions. The removed script will no longer be executed when the cluster is scaled up.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the name of the persisted script action to be removed.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the name of the persisted script action to be removed.
Specifies the name of the resource group.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Removes a script action from the list of persisted script actions on a cluster. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmHDInsightPersistedScriptAction ` -ClusterName "your-hadoop-001" ` -Name "scriptaction"

maml:description.maml:para: Disables HTTP access to the cluster.
The Revoke-AzureRmHDInsightHttpServicesAccess cmdlet disables HTTP access to an Azure HDInsight cluster for ODBC, Ambari, Oozie and webHCatalog web services.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Disable HTTP access to a cluster --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Revoke-AzureRmHDInsightHttpServicesAccess ` -ClusterName "your-hadoop_001"

maml:description.maml:para: Disables Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) access to a Windows cluster.
The Revoke-AzureRmHDInsightRdpServicesAccess cmdlet disables Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) access to a Windows-based Azure HDInsight cluster.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Disable RDP access to a specified cluster --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Revoke-AzureRmHDInsightRdpServicesAccess -ClusterName "your-hadoop-001"

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the number of Worker nodes in a specified cluster.
The Set-AzureRmHDInsightClusterSize cmdlet sets the number of Worker nodes in a specified Azure HDInsight cluster.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the desired number of Worker nodes in the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the desired number of Worker nodes in the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Set the size of a specified cluster --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-AzureRmHDInsightClusterSize -ClusterName "your-hadoop-001" -TargetInstanceCount 6

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the default storage account setting in a cluster configuration object.
The Set-AzureRmHDInsightDefaultStorage cmdlet sets the default storage account setting in the Azure HDInsight cluster configuration object created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the HDInsight cluster configuration object that this cmdlet modifies. This object is created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the default storage account that the HDInsight cluster will use.
Specifies the account key for the default Azure storage account that the HDInsight cluster will use.
Specifies the HDInsight cluster configuration object that this cmdlet modifies. This object is created by the New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the default storage account that the HDInsight cluster will use.
Specifies the account key for the default Azure storage account that the HDInsight cluster will use.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Set the default storage account for the in the cluster configuration object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> # Primary storage account info $storageAccountResourceGroupName = "Group" $storageAccountName = "yourstorageacct001" $storageAccountKey = Get-AzureStorageAccountKey ` -ResourceGroupName $storageAccountResourceGroupName ` -Name $storageAccountName | %{ $_.Key1 } $storageContainer = "container002"
# Cluster configuration info $location = "East US 2" $clusterResourceGroupName = "Group" $clusterName = "your-hadoop-002" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential
# If the cluster's resource group doesn't exist yet, run: # New-AzureRMResourceGroup -Name $clusterResourceGroupName -Location $location
# Create the cluster New-AzureRmHDInsightClusterConfig ` | Set-AzureRmHDInsightDefaultStorage ` -StorageAccountName "$secondStorageAccountName.blob.core.contoso.net" ` -StorageAccountKey $key2 ` -StorageContainer $storageContainer ` | New-AzureRmHDInsightCluster ` -ClusterType Hadoop ` -OSType Windows ` -ClusterSizeInNodes 4 ` -ResourceGroupName $clusterResourceGroupName ` -ClusterName $clusterName ` -HttpCredential $clusterCreds ` -Location $location

maml:description.maml:para: Sets a previously executed script action to be a persisted script action.

Sets a previously executed script action to be a persisted script action. The specified script action must have previously succeeded. The script action will run each time the Azure HDInsight cluster is scaled up.
Specifies the name of the cluster.

Specifies the execution id of the script action to promote to persisted. This script action must have succeeded in order to be promoted. You can find the script action execution ID using Get-AzureRmHDInsightScriptActionHistory.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.

Specifies the execution id of the script action to promote to persisted. This script action must have succeeded in order to be promoted. You can find the script action execution ID using Get-AzureRmHDInsightScriptActionHistory.
Specifies the name of the resource group.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Set a previously successful script action to be persisted, or run on cluster scale up. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmHDInsightPersistedScriptAction ` -ClusterName "your-hadoop-001" ` -ScriptExecutionId "<id>"

maml:description.maml:para: Starts a defined Azure HDInsight job on a specified cluster.
The Start-AzureRMHDInsightJob cmdlet starts a defined Azure HDInsight job on a specified cluster. This can be a MapReduce job, a Streaming MapReduce job, a Hive job, or a Pig job.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the job to start on the Azure HDInsight cluster.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the job to start on the Azure HDInsight cluster.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Start a job on the specified cluster --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> # Cluster info $clusterName = "your-hadoop-001" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential
# Hive job details $statusFolder = "tempStatusFolder/" $query = "SHOW TABLES"
New-AzureRMHDInsightHiveJobDefinition -StatusFolder $statusFolder ` -Query $query ` | Start-AzureRMHDInsightJob -ClusterName $clusterName ` -ClusterCredential $clusterCreds

maml:description.maml:para: Stops a specified running job on a cluster.
The Stop-AzureRmHDInsightJob cmdlet stops a specified running job on an Azure HDInsight cluster.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the job ID of the job.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the job ID of the job.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Stop a job on the specified cluster --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> # Cluster info $clusterName = "your-hadoop-001" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential Stop-AzureRmHDInsightJob -ClusterName $clusterName ` -ClusterCredential $clusterCreds ` -JobId $jobId

maml:description.maml:para: Submits a new script action to an Azure HDInsight cluster.

The Submit-AzureRmHDInsightScriptAction cmdlet submits a new script action to an Azure HDInsight cluster. Use PersistOnSuccess to have the script action run each time the cluster is scaled up, as long as the script action initially succeeds.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the name of the script action.
Specifies the public URI for the script action (a PowerShell or Bash script).
Specifies the node types on which to run the script action.
Specifies the parameters for the script action.

Specifies the application name for the script action. When application name is specified, persist on success should be set to 'False', nodes must contain only 'edgenode' and script action count should equal 1.
Indicates that the script action should run each time the cluster is scaled up. This switch parameter is ignored if the script action initially fails.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the name of the script action.
Specifies the public URI for the script action (a PowerShell or Bash script).
Specifies the node types on which to run the script action.
Specifies the parameters for the script action.

Specifies the application name for the script action. When application name is specified, persist on success should be set to 'False', nodes must contain only 'edgenode' and script action count should equal 1.
Indicates that the script action should run each time the cluster is scaled up. This switch parameter is ignored if the script action initially fails.
Specifies the name of the resource group.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Submit a new script action to a running HDInsight cluster --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Submit-AzureRmHDInsightScriptAction ` -ClusterName "your-hadoop-001" ` -Name "scriptaction" ` -Uri "<script action URI>" ` -NodeTypes Worker -PersistOnSuccess

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Submit a new script action on a running HDInsight cluster with app installed --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Submit-AzureRmHDInsightScriptAction ` -ClusterName "your-hadoop-001" ` -Name "scriptaction" ` -Uri "<script action URI>" ` -ApplicationName "<app name>"` -NodeTypes edgenode

maml:description.maml:para: Selects a cluster to be used with the Invoke-RmAzureHDInsightHiveJob cmdlet.
The Use-AzureRmHDInsightCluster cmdlet selects the Azure HDInsight cluster for the Invoke-AzureRmHDInsightHiveJob cmdlet to use to submit Hive jobs.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Select a cluster for Hive query submission. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> # Cluster info $clusterName = "your-hadoop-001" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential
Use-AzureRmHDInsightCluster -ClusterName $clusterName ` -ClusterCredential $clusterCreds

maml:description.maml:para: Waits for the completion or failure of a specified job.
The Wait-AzureRmHDInsightJob cmdlet awaits the completion or failure of an Azure HDInsight job.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the job ID of the job.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
The total time to wait for job completion, in seconds.
The time to wait between job status checks, in seconds.
Specifies the name of the cluster.
Specifies the job ID of the job.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.
Specifies the name of the resource group.
The total time to wait for job completion, in seconds.
The time to wait between job status checks, in seconds.
Specifies the cluster login (HTTP) credentials for the cluster.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, hadoop, hdinsight, hd, insight

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Wait for the completion or failure of a job --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> # Cluster info $clusterResourceGroupName = "Group" $clusterName = "your-hadoop-001" $clusterCreds = Get-Credential
# Hive job details $statusFolder = "tempStatusFolder/" $query = "SHOW TABLES"
New-AzureRmHDInsightHiveJobDefinition -StatusFolder $statusFolder ` -Query $query ` | Start-AzureRmHDInsightJob -ResourceGroupName $clusterResourceGroupName ` -ClusterName $clusterName ` -ClusterCredential $clusterCreds ` | Wait-AzureRmHDInsightJob -ResourceGroupName $clusterResourceGroupName ` -ClusterName $clusterName ` -ClusterCredential $clusterCreds
